title: Crayke Walks

images.title: Crayke Manor by Paul Buckingham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Crayke Manor. Jacobean manor built in 1620 with stone mullion windows, thick oak beams and yorkstone flags. Now used as a wedding venue.

images.title: Outbuildings, Crayke Manor by Paul Buckingham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Outbuildings, Crayke Manor

images.title: View from the hill at Crayke by Gordon Hatton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View from the hill at Crayke

images.title: Church Hill, Crayke by Pauline E, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Church Hill, Crayke. Crayke stands on the first significant hill to the north of York, marking the boundary between the Vale of York and the Howardian Hills. The village includes the Grade I listed Crayke Castle. The castle consists of a restored 15th-century four-storey tower house with attached outbuildings to the rear and a separate ruined 15th-century tower.

images.title: The infant River Foss, near Crayke Manor by Paul Buckingham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The infant River Foss, near Crayke Manor

images.caption: Oulston Reservoir

images.title: Lake, Newburgh Priory by Maigheach-gheal, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lake, Newburgh Priory

images.title: Byland Abbey by David Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Byland Abbey

description: This picturesque village is located just to the east of Easingwold in the Hambleton District of North Yorkshire. The village is a great base for exploring the surrounding countryside of the Howardian Hills Walks AONB and the Hambleton Hills. This walk from Crayke takes you north to visit some of the highlights of the area. The route follows a section of the Foss Walk long distance trail to visit Oulston Reservoir, Coxwold, Newburgh Priory and Byland Abbey. It's a varied walk with views of the River Foss, woodland trails and two historic sites to see on the way. The 12th century Newburgh Priory includes some lovely grounds with gardens and a lake to admire. At Byland Abbey you can explore the extensive ruins of the 12th century abbey. For an alternative circular walk through the area see the Easingwold Walk .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Head to the 300 year old Durham Ox for some rest and refreshment after your exercise. The historic pub serves good food and also includes a nice garden area for warmer days. There's also a car park here. You can find them on West Way at postcode YO61 4TE for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and country trails are ideal for dogs. The Durham Ox mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Howardian Hills Walks page.

display_address: Brandsby Street, Crayke, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, YO61 4TE, United Kingdom
